name: One Last Job
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Criminal]] enemies in play (to a maximum of 4).
[tablet]: -2 (-4 instead if there is a [[Criminal]] enemy at your location).
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Choose 1 [[Criminal]] enemy discarded by this effect and spawn it engaged with you.

back_flavor:
Moving quickly down the avenue to your next destination, you see a suspicious-looking woman in a long coat step out from a nearby alley. You turn down a side street to avoid her and nearly run into a man with a wicked scar running down his right cheek. He takes a drag from his cigarette, tosses it to the sidewalk, and glowers at you. You step back only to bump into the woman you saw before. She smiles.
"Where you goin', pal? We just wanna talk."
back_text: Spawn 1 set-aside Gang Enforcer enemy engaged with the investigator with the most clues. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
flavor:
The moon casts long shadows that reach across the ground like searching fingers.
You've always seen this city as home, but tonight Arkham feels like another place entirely.
name: Arkham Nightlife
text: [reaction] After the last clue is discovered from an [[Arkham]] location: Discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. One at a time, spawn each [[Criminal]] enemy discarded this way at the nearest empty location.

back_flavor:
No matter where you go, there seems to be a mobster waiting in every back alley, standing casually on the street corner, or watching from shop windows and park benches. It's too dangerous to continue your search, so you head back to Tillinghast's shop. A mob of gangsters intercepts you just a block away. The largest among them steps toward you menacingly, a lit cigarette clenched in his teeth, as his mooks restrain you.
"Didn't anyone ever tell you that curiosity killed the cat?" He leans down and puts his cigarette out on your cheek, then nods to his lackeys, who swiftly beat you down with brass knuckles, bare fists, and bricks.
Message received.
back_text: Each surviving investigator is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.
flavor: Your every step is dogged by both the Sheldons and the O'Bannions. It seems like the two warring gangs have put aside their beef to end your investigation.
name: Long Night
text: [reaction] After the last clue is discovered from an [[Arkham]] location: Discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. One at a time, spawn each [[Criminal]] enemy discarded this way at the nearest empty location.

flavor: You need to find out what happened to Tillinghast's shipment. With the increased gang activity all over Rivertown, you think that checking in with the Sheldons and the O'Bannions is the best place to start.
name: Questioning the Gangs
text: *This act gets +1 [per_investigator] clue threshold. [fast] Spend X clues: Parley. Discard an engaged [[Criminal]] enemy with X remaining health at your location. Place 1 clue (from the token pool) on this act. Objective - At the end of the round, if the number of clues on this act equals or exceeds its clue threshold, advance.

name: Hibb's Roadhouse
text: Easttown is connected to Hibb's Roadhouse. Revelation - Put Hibb's Roadhouse into play. Spawn the set-aside Sadie Sheldon enemy at Hibb's Roadhouse. Add the set-aside act 2a - "The Sheldon Gang" and act 3a - "Face the Music" to the act deck, then advance to act 2a.

flavor: You need to find out what happened to Tillinghast's shipment. With the increased gang activity all over Rivertown, you think that checking in with the Sheldons and the O'Bannions is the best place to start.
name: Questioning the Gangs
text: *This act gets +1 [per_investigator] clue threshold. [fast] Spend X clues: Parley. Discard an engaged [[Criminal]] enemy with X remaining health at your location. Place 1 clue (from the token pool) on this act. Objective - At the end of the round, if the number of clues on this act equals or exceeds its clue threshold, advance.

name: La Bella Luna
text: Downtown is connected to La Bella Luna. Revelation - Put La Bella Luna into play. Spawn the set-aside Naomi O'Bannion enemy at La Bella Luna. Add the set-aside act 2a - "The O'Bannion Gang" and act 3a - "Face the Music" to the act deck, then advance to act 2a.

back_flavor:
Your negotiations are cut short as Naomi O'Bannion strides into Hibb's Roadhouse, accompanied by a pair of mobsters.
"That shipment is mine, Sadie" she says coldly. You duck down as her goons pull out their rifles and spray the walls and furniture with a hail of bullets.
back_text: Spawn the set-aside Naomi O'Bannion and Gang Enforcer enemies at Hibb's Roadhouse. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 copy of Gang Soldier and spawn it at Hibb's Roadhouse. If there is at least 1 clue on Sadie Sheldon, place 2 damage on Naomi O'Bannion. Move up to 2 clues from Sadie Sheldon to any non-[[Elite]], [[Criminal]] enemies at Hibb's Roadhouse. Each enemy with clues on it disengages from each investigator and gains aloof (while there are clues on it).
flavor: The Sheldons wound up with the shipment. It's up to you to either talk Sadie into a deal, or "convince" her it's not worth the trouble.
name: The Sheldon Gang
text: Sadie Sheldon gains: "[action] Spend up to 4 resources: Parley. Test [willpower] or [combat] (5). This test gets -1 difficulty for each resource spent as part of this action's cost. For each point you succeed by, place 1 of your clues on Sadie Sheldon." Objective - When damage is placed on Sadie Sheldon, advance. Objective - If there are 3 clues on Sadie Sheldon, advance.

back_flavor: There is a sound of a struggle at the entrance to the swanky lounge, followed by a muffled scream. Sadie Sheldon bursts into La Bella Luna accompanied by several rough-and-tumble mooks. They crack their knuckles when they see you, and advance at Sheldon's signal.
back_text: Spawn the set-aside Sadie Sheldon and Gang Enforcer enemies at La Bella Luna. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 copy of Gang Soldier and spawn it at La Bella Luna. If there is at least 1 clue on Naomi O'Bannion, place 2 damage on Sadie Sheldon. Move up to 2 clues from Naomi O'Bannion to any non-[[Elite]], [[Criminal]] enemies at La Bella Luna. Each enemy with clues on it disengages from each investigator and gains aloof (while there are clues on it).
flavor: The O'Bannions nicked Tillinghast's shipment. It's up to you to either talk Naomi into a deal, or "convince" her it's not worth the trouble.
name: The O'Bannion Gang
text: Naomi O'Bannion gains: "[action] Spend up to 4 resources: Parley. Test [intellect] or [agility] (5). This test gets -1 difficulty for each resource spent as part of this action's cost. For each point you succeed by, place 1 of your clues on Naomi O'Bannion." Objective - When damage is placed on Naomi O'Bannion, advance. Objective - If there are 3 clues on Naomi O'Bannion, advance.

back_flavor: As the conflict erupts into outright bloodshed, you locate a small crate labeled "Tillinghast Endeavors" in a back room. Keeping low to the ground, you scamper through the fight and back out to the cold evening air. The sound of shattering glass and heavy blows emanates from the building behind you. "Aw, applesauce," says a voice above you. A compact figure clad in black slides down a rappelling line and removes their mask. "I had a whole heist planned, you know. An informant. A calling card, even," Ruby says, tossing a yellow rose on the pavement. "I didn't think you could just walk in and ask politely, but, well, I guess you won fair and square."
flavor: You've found yourself squarely in the center of a gang war!
name: Face the Music
text: Each [[Criminal]] enemy with clues on it gains aloof. [action] Remove 1 clue from a [[Criminal]] enemy at your location: Parley. That enemy deals its damage to another enemy at your location. Objective - When the round ends, if there is at least 1 [[Elite]] enemy in the victory display, advance.

back_flavor: "Tillinghast Esoterica - purveyor of sundry delights, exotic treasures, wondrous baubles, and innumerable secrets." - Recent ad in the Arkham Advertiser
back_text: Tillinghast Esoterica is connected to the location to the right of it, and vice versa.

name: The Western Wall
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is your location's level.
[cultist]: -3. If you fail and your location is fully flooded, take 1 damage.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, increase the flood level of your location.

back_flavor: One wrong step sends you careening away from the ruined wall. As you look out into the abyssal darkness of the ocean depths, you have the illusion of drifting in the vastness of space. It is utterly serene. A sharp tug pulls your attention away: your line is caught on a falling chunk of foundation. Another sharp tug follows. You are drawn back to safety, but not without a heavy bruise and some wounded pride.
back_text: Each surviving investigator is defeated and suffers 1 mental trauma.
flavor: You can navigate a path through the crumbling ruins via small pockets of air.
name: Flooded Paths
text: Each location is connected to each other location on the rows above and below it. Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location or decrease the flood level of your current location, take 5 direct damage.

back_flavor: Andy Van Nortwick is the last to tumble into the ring of black columns at the base of the city. He looks out in awe at a shimmering energy field in the center of the underwater plaza. The field ripples around the columns like a persistent bubble, creating a pocket of breathable air. A long meandering tunnel winds from your position to the entrance of the underwater dome. You have reached the sea floor at last.
flavor: A softly pulsing light at the base of the ancient foundations beckons you to the sea floor. You must proceed carefully.
name: Descend into the Abyss
text: [fast] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Decrease your location's flood level. Objective – Make your way to the sea floor! If each surviving investigator is at Obsidian Foundations, advance.

back_flavor: Ruby helps you up the slick black rocks to stand on the edge of what was once an ancient walkway. R'lyeh has risen noticeably since you arrived: the sunken western wall tower precariously over the turgid waters like an ancient citadel. The bay where you first made camp has receded as well. Not far off, you can see the Cassandra bob on the black waves. It won't be a long trek back to where you made landfall.
flavor: It is a steep climb up the crumbling wall, but if you step carefully, you should reach the surface in one piece.
name: Ascend the Wall
text: [fast] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Decrease your location's flood level. Objective – Make your way to the surface! If each surviving investigator is at Western Wall, advance.

back_flavor: The path is both perilous and breathtaking in equal measure. A brilliant green glow emanates from below, illuminating schools of fish and deep sea creatures.

name: Seafloor Frieze [tdc_rune_w]
text: Revelation - Attach Seafloor Frieze [tdc_rune_w] to your location. Cannot be canceled. Seafloor Frieze [tdc_rune_w] cannot leave play. [action]: Test [combat] (2), then test [willpower] (2). If you succeed at both tests, flip this card and resolve its text.

name: Seafloor Frieze [tdc_rune_w]
text:
Below the frieze is a triptych of three distinct scenes. The first panel depicts a comet falling from the sky. The center panel, while highly abstract, shows legions of nightmarish alien shapes pouring out of fallen rocks. Their faces are covered in thick, ropy appendages. The frieze depicts the alien creatures trampling a forest of what looks like thick, boxy flowering trees. The final frieze depicts a wave of sinewy, wormlike creatures spilling out from the celestial rocks like a flood.
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_w] In your Campaign Log, record "Parasite" under [tdc_rune_w] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

text: [action]: Test [intellect] (X), where X is this location's level. If you succeed, flip this card and resolve its text.

name: The Undersea Vault [tdc_rune_z]
text:
You press three small hidden nodes inset into the vault door and it slides open with a satisfying hiss. Inside is a desiccated corpse of an alien creature, its octopoid face and leathery wings reduced to dust. It holds an obsidian slate in one bony hand; you identify it as a kind of city map, likely of R'lyeh itself.
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_z] In your Campaign Log, record "City" under [tdc_rune_z] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Flip this card back to its location side. It cannot be flipped over again.

back_flavor: The tunnels branch and merge like blood vessels in a vast alien gullet. Every surface is covered in fleshy organic growths. What you first thought were tremors were the tunnels themselves: tightening and expanding like the muscles of a large trachea. As you round a corner, you see a nightmarish creature with sightless, buggy eyes slither out of sight.
back_text: Place clues on each location without victory X up to its clue value. Shuffle the set-aside Grotesque Amalgam enemy with the encounter discard pile and place those cards on the bottom of the encounter deck.
flavor: You can hear the sound of slithering and gnashing teeth in the darkness. Something awful stirs in the bowels of R'lyeh. You would rather not stick around to find out what it actually is...
name: Stirring in the Dark

back_flavor: A horde of stinking pustulous creatures chases you into a dark culvert. You hide within a fleshy fold of wall and hope for the best. After what feels like hours, the halls grow silent. Breathing a sigh of relief, you try to push the fold back only to find it has latched onto your arm with a sticky, gluey substance. As you try to pull away from it, the skin on your hand and arm sloughs off loosely, and with little pain. You stare in horror at your degloved palm. An orange tendril snakes past your ear to encircle your neck. You are being digested alive.
back_text: Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated.
flavor: Loathsome creatures emerge from every nook and cranny. If you don't escape soon, you have a feeling you'll become a permanent resident.
name: Loathsome Parasites
text: Forced - When doom is placed on this agenda, if there are no non-[[Elite]] enemies in play: Reveal cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is revealed and spawn it (at an empty location, if able). Shuffle each other revealed card and place them on top of the encounter deck.

back_text:
If each investigator is at Lost Campsite:
After searching the campsite, you find yourselves surrounded by robed figures holding torches, but no weapons. A soft-faced woman in a patchwork cloak emerges from the crowd. "Please, don't be alarmed. We have no intention of harming you."
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Proceed to Interlude: Lost Pilgrims (page 21).
If each investigator is at Acidic Coelom:
You hear a hiss, then feel sharp, stinging pain in your back. As you lose consciousness, look around and see a prehensile limb buried in your spine.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Proceed to Interlude: The Hive Mind (page 22).
flavor: The fleshy tunnels excrete a foul, waxy substance that burns the skin. Your destination lies deeper within the disgusting labyrinth.
name: Unsettling Signs
text: [action] Spend 1 or more clues, as a group: For each clue spent, discard the top 5 cards (10 cards instead if there is 1 investigator) of the encounter deck and draw each location discarded by this effect. Objective - If each surviving investigator is at a [[Sanctum]] location, investigators may spend the requisite clues, as a group, to advance.(Hint: you may not be able to explore further after you advance.)

back_text:
If there are 3 or more Cultist cards under this act:
The tunnels buckle and spasm as you flee the apiary. You usher the last of the surviving pilgrims out as the alien parasites screech in primal rage behind you. You are safe... for now.
(→R1) (page 23).
Otherwise:
The tunnels buckle and spasm as you flee the apiary. You hear the pilgrims' agonized screams behind you. Suddenly the screams stop, replaced by the sound of gnashing mouths and tearing flesh. You were one of the fortunate ones.
(→R2) (page 23).
flavor: The campsite is under attack by alien parasites!
name: Lost Pilgrims
text: Each [[Cultist]] enemy gains victory 0 and aloof. [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (2) or [combat] (2). For each point you succeed by, move a different [[Cultist]] enemy at your location once in any direction. Forced - When the enemy phase ends: Each [[Cultist]] enemy takes 1 damage for each [[Stowaway]] enemy at its location. Objective - When the round ends, if there is a combined total of 5 or more [[Cultist]] cards in the victory display and/or under this act, you must advance.

back_flavor: "Hey, ugly! Eat this!" Ruby shouts as she empties her pistol into the Mother's sagging flesh. The queen parasite screams in pain. Around you, the other stowaways chitter and squeal in tandem, then go limp as their mother expires. Ruby's face is wild as she stomps each of the parasites in turn, just to make sure they're dead. You examine the creatures' remains. Without the Mother to control them, the parasites are inert.
flavor: It doesn't live in the walls! It is the walls!
name: The Hive Mind
text: [fast] During your turn, place X clues on your location: Deal X damage to a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. Forced - When the round ends: Flip a coin. On heads, rotate Central Chamber once clockwise. On tails, rotate Central Chamber once counter-clockwise. Objective - If Mother is defeated, immediately advance.

name: Apiary Entrance
text: [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Shuffle each location in the encounter discard pile into the bottom 10 cards of the encounter deck. [fast]: Choose the farthest location from Apiary Entrance. Place clues on the chosen location up to its clue value. (Limit once per round.) [action]: Resign. You make your exit.

name: Apiary Entrance
text: When a [[Stowaway]] enemy is drawn, spawn it at Apiary Entrance instead of its normal spawn location. [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place a [[Cultist]] asset or enemy at this location underneath the act. [action]: Resign. You make your exit.

name: Fleshy Paths
text: Revelation - Put Fleshy Paths into play. [action]: Test [intellect] (2) to search the flesh-like walls. If you succeed, put the set-aside Ancient Relic [tdc_rune_s] asset into play under your control.

name: Fleshy Paths [tdc_rune_r]
text: Revelation - Put Fleshy Paths [tdc_rune_r] into play. [action] You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_r] In your Campaign Log, record "Time" under [tdc_rune_r] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated.

name: Growing Fields
text: Revelation - Put Growing Fields into play along with the set-aside Hidden Vault [tdc_rune_u] location. [action]: Test [willpower] (8). Double the skill icons of each card committed to this test. If you succeed, take control of the set-aside Grisly "Mask" story asset.

name: Churning Chasm
text: Revelation - Put Churning Chasm into play and spawn the set-aside Squamous Parasite [tdc_rune_t] enemy at it. [reaction] When you begin your turn in Churning Chasm: Move to any revealed location.

name: Corrupted Vault [tdc_rune_q]
text: Revelation - Put Corrupted Vault [tdc_rune_q] into play. [action][action]: You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_q] In your Campaign Log, record "Hand" under [tdc_rune_q] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated.

name: Luminous Tunnels
text: Revelation - Put Luminous Tunnels into play. Shuffle the set-aside Pilgrims encounter set into the encounter deck along with the encounter discard pile. Find the set-aside Spawning Grounds and Corrupted Vault [tdc_rune_q] and shuffle them into the bottom 10 cards of the encounter deck. [action] Take 1 damage: Place clues on the location farthest from Apiary Entrance up to its clue value.

name: Spawning Grounds
text: Revelation - Put Spawning Grounds into play. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Find the set-aside Lost Campsite and Churning Chasm and shuffle them into the bottom 10 cards of the encounter deck.

flavor: The camp is seemingly abandoned, strewn with dishware and tattered tents. Perhaps there are survivors hiding nearby.
name: Lost Campsite
text: Revelation - Put Lost Campsite into play. [action]: Draw the topmost card beneath Lost Campsite.

name: Maria Rivera
text: When damage would be placed on a [[Cultist]] enemy at your location, place it on Maria Rivera instead. [reaction] When doom would be placed on a [[Cultist]] enemy, exhaust Maria Rivera: Place it on Maria Rivera instead, as damage. Forced - If Maria Rivera is defeated: Add her to the victory display.

name: Grasping Corridor
text: Revelation - Put Grasping Corridor into play. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Find the set-aside Starving Corridor and Corrupted Vault [tdc_rune_q] and shuffle them into the bottom 10 cards of the encounter deck. [action] Take 1 horror: Place clues on the location farthest from Apiary Entrance up to its clue value.

name: Starving Corridor
text: Revelation - Put Starving Corridor into play. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Find the set-aside Acidic Coelom and Churning Chasm and shuffle them into the bottom 10 cards of the encounter deck.

flavor: The acidic vapors digest anything inside the chamber, including flesh and metal.
name: Acidic Coelom
text: Revelation - Put Acidic Coelom into play. As an additional cost to move from Acidic Coelom to Apiary Entrance, you must take 1 damage.

back_flavor: A rhythmic thud reverberates through the walls of the chamber like a heartbeat.
back_text: Central Chamber is connected to the location below it (bordering its bottom edge) and vice versa.
name: Central Chamber
text: Central Chamber is connected to the location below it (bordering its bottom edge) and vice versa. Forced - When your turn ends, if you are at this location: Test [agility] (1). If you fail, you must either move to a connecting location or Mother attacks you.

name: Mother
text: Massive. Relentless. Forced - When another [[Stowaway]] enemy is defeated: Move all damage on that enemy to Mother. (If that enemy had doom on it, shuffle that enemy into the encounter deck as well.)

name: Grotesque Amalgam
text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After you fight this enemy using a [[Weapon]] asset: Place 1 doom on that asset.

name: Apiary Tender
text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Lowest [agility]. Forced - When doom is placed on a card at this location: Ready Apiary Tender. It loses aloof until the end of the round. If it is engaged with an investigator, it makes an immediate attack.

name: Hungry Walls
text: Revelation - Attach this card to your location. Forced - When you leave attached location: Test [agility] (4) or [combat] (4). If you fail and you tested... - ...[agility], discard an asset you control and take 1 damage. Discard Hungry Walls. - ...[combat], take 2 direct damage. Discard Hungry Walls.

name: Dangerous Curiosity
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (X), where X is your location's shroud value. If you fail, take 1 damage and discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Stowaway]] enemy is discarded and draw it. Shuffle each location discarded by this effect back into the encounter deck.

flavor: What is that moving inside?
name: Alien Eggs
text: Surge. Revelation - Place 1 doom on the nearest non-[[Elite]] enemy with no doom on it.

name: Hidden Vault [tdc_rune_u]
text: Forced - After Hidden Vault [tdc_rune_u] enters play: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and spawn it at this location. [reaction] After you successfully evade an enemy at Hidden Vault [tdc_rune_u] by 2 or more: Flip this card and resolve its text.

name: Hidden Vault [tdc_rune_u]
text:
You find an alien panel hidden behind a fold of fleshy wall. Grimacing, you press it and reveal a round alcove untouched by the alien growths. Sharp glowing symbols connected by curling lines appear on a black slate in the center of the alcove. After some study, you recognize it as some kind of ancestral tree. There are hundreds upon hundreds of names: how many creatures lived in this city aeons ago?
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_u] In your Campaign Log, record "Daughters" under [tdc_rune_u] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Flip this card back to its location side. It cannot be flipped over again.

name: Squamous Parasite [tdc_rune_t]
text: Retaliate. If Squamous Parasite [tdc_rune_t] would leave play, set it aside, out of play. Forced - When you defeat Squamous Parasite [tdc_rune_t]: Flip this enemy and resolve its text.

name: Squamous Parasite [tdc_rune_t]
text:
The alien creature's hard carapace crumbles to reveal a shining black sigil. It must have devoured this piece of technology... or was it assembled from it? Pressing the sigil projects an image of a cloudy golden sky. Somewhere not of this world. A series of glyphs and descending lines overlay the scene. Eventually, their meaning becomes clear.
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_t] In your Campaign Log, record "Air" under [tdc_rune_t] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

name: Ancient Relic [tdc_rune_s]
text: If Ancient Relic [tdc_rune_s] would leave play, set it aside, out of play. Forced - After you take 1 or more damage: Deal 1 damage to Ancient Relic [tdc_rune_s]. [reaction] When you end the game with Ancient Relic [tdc_rune_s] under your control: Flip this card and resolve its text.

name: Grisly "Mask"
text:
[fast] Exhaust Grisly "Mask": Disengage from each enemy. Until the beginning of your next turn, you cannot move and cannot damage enemies or engage them.
[tdc_rune_j] · [tdc_rune_m] · [tdc_rune_s] · [tdc_rune_c] · [tdc_rune_b]
[fast] Take 1 direct horror and exhaust Grisly "Mask": Deal 2 damage to an enemy at your location.

name: Parasitic Transformation
text: Revelation - Put Parasitic Transformation into play in your threat area. Forced - After an enemy engages you: Place 1 doom on Parasitic Transformation. [action][action]: Discard Parasitic Transformation.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the number of activated locations.
[cultist]: -4. After this test resolves, you must either deactivate your location or take 1 damage and 1 horror.
[tablet]: -3 (-4 instead if your location is partially flooded; -5 instead if your location is fully flooded).
[elder_thing]: -5. If you fail, search the encounter discard pile for a copy of the Still Behind You treachery and draw it.
name: The Grand Vault
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of activated locations (rounded down).
[cultist]: -3. If you fail, you must either deactivate your location or take 1 damage or 1 horror.
[tablet]: -2 (-3 instead if your location is partially flooded; -4 instead if your location is fully flooded).
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, search the encounter discard pile for a copy of the Still Behind You treachery and add it to the victory display.

back_flavor: As you begin to make sense of the ever-shifting complex of maze-like corridors and chambers, a crack appears in one wall. The crack grows wider as two massive clawed hands push a hidden door open. A familiar imposing frame emerges from the darkness, glowering at you. Your tireless pursuer is here yet again.
back_text:
Spawn the set-aside The Inescapable enemy at the lead investigator's location. Choose an investigator at that location to test [agility] (4). If they succeed, disengage The Inescapable from each investigator and exhaust it.
Shuffle each copy of the set-aside Still Behind You treachery and 1 random set-aside [[Star Spawn]] enemy, along with the encounter deck and discard pile, into the encounter deck.
flavor: The oppressive darkness is filled with the sound of crushing, gnashing machinery.
name: Bowels of the City
text: Forced - When your turn begins, if your location is fully flooded, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter a partially flooded or unflooded location during your turn, or decrease your location's flood level, take 5 direct damage.

back_flavor: The incessant cacophony makes it difficult to hear anything, even the sound of your pursuer's footfalls. He could be lurking around any corner. It is only a matter of time before you are found.
back_text:
Search all in- and out-of-play areas for each copy of the Still Behind You treachery. Shuffle these cards, the set-aside [[Star Spawn]] enemy, and the encounter discard pile, into the encounter deck.
Move each unengaged Persistent Construct enemy in play to the Moving Platform, exhausted and unengaged.
If The Inescapable is in play, heal 1 [per_investigator] damage from it and move it once toward the nearest investigator. Each location is considered to be connected to each adjacent location during this movement.
flavor: This thing won't stop unless you find a way to put it down for good.
name: Devil in the Machine
text: The Inescapable gets +1 [per_investigator] health. When The Inescapable moves via its hunter keyword, each location is considered to be connected to each adjacent location. Forced - When your turn begins, if your location is fully flooded, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter a partially flooded or unflooded location during your turn, or decrease your location's flood level, take 5 direct damage.

back_flavor: You find yourself trapped in a small cubic room. Dark water pours out of ancient sluices, rising to your waist, then chest, then neck. Your very bones seem to vibrate with the unceasing thrum of the heart of the city. Pushing panic aside, you press glowing nodes and panels in a futile attempt to drain the chamber, but to no result. Gulping a few last breaths, you dive down, searching for any way out. You just barely squeeze through a massive sluice, struggling against the current. At long last, you tumble out into a deep reservoir filled with icy black water. Below you, the silhouettes of star spawn swim slowly, inexorably toward you. They move without haste, for they know that there is no rush: you have no escape.
back_text: Each surviving investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.
flavor: With great effort and no small amount of luck, you may still be able to escape.
name: Devil in the Machine
text: The Inescapable gets +2 [per_investigator] health. When The Inescapable moves via its hunter keyword, each location is considered to be connected to each adjacent location. Forced - When your turn begins, if your location is fully flooded, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter a partially flooded or unflooded location during your turn, or decrease your location's flood level, take 5 direct damage.

back_flavor:
With an undeniable sense of triumph, you pry the tablet from its resting place in the center of the chamber. It pulses in your hands in time to the thrumming machinery, sending ripples through the shallow water at your feet. Small tendrils of water snake upward to hang, suspended, around you. You wave the tablet once and watch the water on the floor rise and crash against the right wall of the chamber.
Satisfied with your find, you prepare to leave. However, you wonder if there are any other mysteries you have yet to uncover at the very heart of R'lyeh...
back_text: Increase the flood level of each location that can have its flood level increased. Place clues on each revealed [[Vault]] location without victory X up to its clue threshold.
flavor: The machinery that serves as the beating heart of R'lyeh is alien in design, but not inscrutable. Thanks to all you've learned up to this point, you may be able to find your way through.
name: Careful Navigation
text: [reaction] After the investigators have translated any 3 of the following glyphs ([tdc_rune_l], [tdc_rune_m], [tdc_rune_n], [tdc_rune_p], [tdc_rune_o]): Reveal the Sealed Chamber location. (Hint: Each of these glyphs are found in this scenario.). Objective - When the round ends, if an investigator controls the Tidal Tablet story asset, advance.

back_flavor: At long last, you reach the exit. After a short climb, you return to the towering precipice overlooking the ancient vault. There, you are surprised to find the other half of the expedition camped on the overlook, staring down at the churning machinery and turgid waters. Rather than press on, you and the others resolve to rest and share your findings as a group.
back_text: Check your Campaign log. - If the expedition headed west, (→R1) (page 27). - If the expedition headed east, (→R2) (page 27).
flavor: There is only one way in and one way out of the ancient vault, but your route back is fraught with danger. Frothing water continues to pour in, carried by the great waterworks from the rest of the city.
name: Back Through the Machine
text: Objective - If each surviving investigator has resigned, advance.

back_flavor: The stone stairwell appears to be the main way to access much of the eastern side of the city. It is engulfed in darkness, but the walls and steps vibrate with the constant movement of immense machines hidden just beyond the walls.
name: The Great Stair
text: The Great Stair cannot be flooded. [action]: Resign. You venture into darkness, leaving the churning machinery behind.

back_flavor: The platform floats near the ceiling of a massive chamber beneath the city of R'lyeh. Your flashlights barely illuminate the series of individual rooms and halls below.
back_text:
Moving Platform cannot be flooded.
Moving Platform is connected to each adjacent location, and vice versa.
name: Moving Platform
text:
Moving Platform cannot be flooded.
Moving Platform is connected to each adjacent location, and vice versa.
[fast] Investigators at Moving Platform spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Swap Moving Platform with an adjacent [[Vault]] location.

back_flavor: The heart of the great vault is a massive, sealed chamber filled with alien glyphs and bizarre machinery.
back_text: Core of the Vault cannot be flooded. Forced - At the end of the round, if each [[Vault]] location has been activated: Reveal Core of the Vault.
name: Core of the Vault
text: Core of the Vault cannot be flooded. Forced - If The Inescapable is defeated at this location: Search all in- and out-of-play areas for each copy of Still Behind You and remove them from the game. In your Campaign Log, record the creature was defeated. [action] [action] Spend 3 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: You study the machine. Proceed to Scenario Interlude: The Vault Core (page 26).

back_flavor:
"One could not be sure that the sea and the ground were horizontal, hence the relative position of everything else seemed phantasmally variable."
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"
name: Shrouded Cistern
text: This location's flood level cannot be decreased. Forced - After Shrouded Cistern is revealed: Increase its flood level. [action]: You open up a new passageway. Activate this location. Then, increase the flood level of any eligible [[Vault]] location.

back_flavor:
"One could not be sure that the sea and the ground were horizontal, hence the relative position of everything else seemed phantasmally variable."
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"

[action]: Activate this location.
[reaction] After the last clue is discovered from this location, you discover this glyph:
[tdc_rune_l]
In your Campaign Log, record "Arm" under [tdc_rune_l] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated.

"One could not be sure that the sea and the ground were horizontal, hence the relative position of everything else seemed phantasmally variable."
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"

text:
[action]: Activate this location.
[reaction] After the last clue is discovered from this location, you discover this glyph:
[tdc_rune_m]
In your Campaign Log, record "Earth" under [tdc_rune_m] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated.

-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"
name: Otherworldly Mechanisms
text: Forced - When you reveal Otherworldly Mechanisms: Draw 1 random set-aside [[Glyph]] treachery, if able. [action] Choose and discard 3 cards from your hand: Activate this location.

back_flavor:
"One could not be sure that the sea and the ground were horizontal, hence the relative position of everything else seemed phantasmally variable."
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"

back_flavor:
"One could not be sure that the sea and the ground were horizontal, hence the relative position of everything else seemed phantasmally variable."
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"
name: Otherworldly Mechanisms
text: Forced - When you reveal Otherworldly Mechanisms: Draw 1 random set-aside [[Glyph]] treachery, if able. [action] Spend 5 resources: Activate this location.

back_flavor:
"One could not be sure that the sea and the ground were horizontal, hence the relative position of everything else seemed phantasmally variable."
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"
name: Otherworldly Mechanisms
text: Forced - When you reveal Otherworldly Mechanisms: Draw 1 random set-aside [[Glyph]] treachery, if able. [action] Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck: Draw each revealed weakness and remove the rest from the game. Activate this location.

back_flavor: The locks on the door to this chamber glow with four different alien symbols. Pressing your ear to the metal, the constant drone of the vault machinery melts away, and you hear the faintest sounds of crashing waves beyond the door.
back_text:
Sealed Chamber cannot be flooded.
Investigators cannot enter Sealed Chamber.
name: Chamber of the Tablet
text:
Chamber of the Tablet cannot be flooded.
Chamber of the Tablet is connected to the location to the left of it, and vice versa.
[reaction] After the last clue is discovered from Chamber of the Tablet: Choose an investigator at this location to take control of the set-aside Tidal Tablet story asset.

name: Slitherer in Darkness
text: Spawn - Nearest flooded location. Slitherer in Darkness cannot enter unflooded locations. Forced - When the enemy phase begins, if there are no investigators at this enemy's location: This enemy attacks the investigator with the lowest [combat] at a connecting location. If no attack was made, Slitherer in Darkness moves to the flooded location nearest the Moving Platform.

name: Vault Attendant
text: Hunter. Spawn - Engaged with prey. Prey - Most clues. When Vault Attendant moves via its hunter keyword, its location is considered to be connected to each activated location.

name: Deadly Mechanisms
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must decide (choose one; choose two instead if it is act 2): - Deactivate the nearest activated [[Vault]] location. - Draw 1 of the set-aside Vault Attendant enemies. - Move to an adjacent location (flooded if able).

name: Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_o]
text: Revelation - Attach Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_o] to your location. Cannot be canceled. [action] Choose and discard assets from your play area with a total printed resource cost of at least X, where X is the shroud value of attached location: Flip this card over and resolve its text.

name: Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_o]
text:
A small switch at the base of the wall opens into a cramped musty room. As you enter, a small glyph in the floor begins to glow a dim green. The light intensifies until it is blindingly bright, and the air in the room begins to crackle with energy. The glyph flares even brighter, then goes dark. The symbol's meaning will forever be burned into your memory.
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_o] In your Campaign Log, record "Power" under [tdc_rune_o] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

name: Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_n]
text: Revelation - Attach Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_n] to your location. Cannot be canceled. [action] Take a combined total of X damage and/or horror, where X is attached location's shroud: Flip this card over.

name: Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_n]
text:
Within the ancient vault is a large octagonal room that resembles a kind of laboratory. A central console resembles a clawed hand, with two of its "fingers" raised. Nodes in the console project a glowing translucent letter. Curious, you press one hand to a central node. A vision overwhelmes your mind: a torrential wave, a sundered mountain, burning forests and atmosphere. You pull one hand away, uncertain of what you just experienced. A record? A vision?
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_n] In your Campaign Log, record "Doom" under [tdc_rune_n] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

name: Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_p]
text: Revelation - Attach Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_p] to your location. Cannot be canceled. [action] Choose and discard X cards from your hand, where X is attached location's shroud: Flip this card over.

name: Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_p]
text:
The room within the vault is dark and featureless, save for an incandescent, smoky orb suspended in the center. Inspecting it closer, you find a full-scale model of an alien planet. Small storm systems move along the surface at an accelerated rate, swirling and dissipating in seconds. When you touch it, your senses are assailed by invisible gales, torrential rain, and a crack of thunder. Lines of swirling alien writing appear on the globe, conveying a record of an ancient storm.
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_p] In your Campaign Log, record "Weather" under [tdc_rune_p] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

name: Tidal Tablet
text:
[reaction] When your location's flood level is increased: Move to a connecting location.
[tdc_rune_l] · [tdc_rune_k] · [tdc_rune_d]
[fast] Exhaust Tidal Tablet: Increase the flood level of your location. Then, choose another flooded location and decrease its flood level.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 1 more than the number of [[Glyph]] cards in the victory display.
[cultist]: -3 (-5 instead if there is a [[Stowaway]] enemy at your location).
[tablet]: -3. If your location is flooded, reveal another token.
[elder_thing]: -5. If this token is revealed during an attack or evasion attempt, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
name: Court of the Ancients
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Glyph]] cards in the victory display.
[cultist]: -2 (-4 instead if there is a [[Stowaway]] enemy at your location).
[tablet]: -2. If your location is flooded, reveal another token.
[elder_thing]: -4. If this token is revealed during an attack or evasion attempt, take 1 damage or 1 horror.

back_flavor: As supernatural winds howl outside, the tower groans and sways like an ancient tree weathering a storm. You steady yourself against a pillar, hoping to wait out the tremor. Suddenly, you feel the pillar loosen. Stepping away, you watch the intricately carved pillar tumble down to the bottom far below.
back_text: Shuffle each [[Omen]] and [[Glyph]] card in the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
flavor: The massive tower rises above you, promising enticing knowledge and forbidden truths. However, the imminent peril of navigating the ancient, crumbling structure comes into sharp focus as a chunk of obsidian crashes down nearby. For all its grandeur, you are not safe here.
name: Ruined Archives

back_flavor: As supernatural winds howl outside, the tower groans and sways like an ancient tree weathering a storm. You steady yourself against a pillar, hoping to wait out the tremor. Suddenly, you feel the pillar loosen. Stepping away, you watch the intricately carved pillar tumble down to the bottom far below. You pause, waiting to hear a splash, but there is none. The water below has receded. The city continues to rise like a long-dead corpse from the sea depths.
back_text:
Decrease the flood level of each location.
Shuffle each [[Omen]] and [[Glyph]] card in the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
flavor: The massive tower promises enticing knowledge and forbidden truths. However, the imminent peril of navigating the ancient, crumbling structure comes into sharp focus as a chunk of obsidian crashes down to the flooded depths below. For all its grandeur, you are not safe here.
name: Flooded Archives
text: Forced - When your turn begins, if your location is fully flooded, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.

back_flavor: The tower shudders as all of R'lyeh continues to ascend. Ancient symbols on the court walls flash with blinding bright intensity. In your momentary blindness, you catch glimpses of blasphemous, hulking shapes of ancient creatures on what looks like a familiar black-sanded beach. An emerald sun reflects on oily black water of a distant alien shore. Every fiber of your being screams in protest as the sheer volume of history within the tower surges into your pitifully small mind all at once. Before you know it, you collapse on the stone floor and slip into a dark and restless slumber...
back_text: Each surviving investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers 1 mental trauma.
flavor: The tower groans as R'lyeh continues its slow ascent from the depths of the ocean.
name: Unstable Foundations
text: During the enemy phase, each location is considered to be connected to the location above and below it. Forced - After the Great Lift moves: Each investigator at the Great Lift must test [agility] (2). Each investigator who fails takes 1 damage.

back_flavor: Ancient gears, unused for millennia, grind to life with a gut-wrenching sound. The lift shudders erratically as a massive creature claws its way up through one of the holes in the floor. It would appear this monstrosity resided on the underside of the lift, and you have awakened it!
back_text: Spawn the set-aside Colossal Tyrant enemy at the Great Lift. Choose an investigator at the Great Lift to test [agility] (3). If they succeed, exhaust the Colossal Tyrant.
flavor: The halls and tall ceilings are divided into massive stacks, like the shelves of a library. There is so much you could learn here.
name: Steps of Giants
text: [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Discard the top 5 cards of the encounter deck (8 cards instead if there is only 1 investigator). Draw 1 [[Glyph]] card discarded by this effect. Then, one at a time, draw each [[Omen]] card discarded by this effect. Objective - After the Great Lift flips to its (Active) side, immediately advance.

back_flavor: You reach the topmost floor of the tower and search for any way to escape from the collapsing structure. The paths down are choked with rubble. The openings in the ceiling seem to be your only hope...
flavor: Your only hope is to find the relic, if you can, and get out before the entire tower crumbles around you!
name: Escape the Tower (v.I)
text: [action] If you are at Twisting Catwalks: Resign. [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Discard the top 5 cards of the encounter deck (8 cards instead if there is only 1 investigator). Draw 1 [[Glyph]] card discarded by this effect. Then, one at a time, draw each [[Omen]] card discarded by this effect. Objective - If each surviving investigator has resigned, advance.

back_flavor: You reach the bottom of this side of the tower and find a round dais that resembles some kind of door. As destruction rains down around you, the expedition members frantically press the glowing nodes and panels, hoping for a way out.
flavor: Your only hope is to find the relic, if you can, and get out before the entire tower crumbles around you!
name: Escape the Tower (v.II)
text: [action] If you are at East Antechamber: Resign. [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Discard the top 5 cards of the encounter deck (8 cards instead if there is only 1 investigator). Draw 1 [[Glyph]] card discarded by this effect. Then, one at a time, draw each [[Omen]] card discarded by this effect. Objective - If each surviving investigator has resigned, advance.

back_flavor: The once grand archway that opened out onto the streets of R'lyeh has long since collapsed, any hope of exit dashed by the choking rubble.

text: [fast] During your turn, investigators at this location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group (2 [per_investigator] clues instead if this location is flooded): Slide the Great Lift down once.

back_flavor: The floor of this chamber is dominated by a large circular slab covered in intricate alien carvings. Walking on its surface feels distinctly different than the other parts of the tower. The slab may cover a passage leading deeper into the city...

text: [fast] During your turn, investigators at this location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group (2 [per_investigator] clues instead if this location is flooded): Slide the Great Lift down once.

back_flavor: There is more to this storm than just bad weather. As the gales howl around you, the alien landscape buckles and shifts before your very eyes, blurring your vision. When you regain focus, the skyline looks unfamiliar.

back_flavor: As you admire the skyline, you see the elephantine shape of a winged creature climbing up from below. You are being hunted.
back_text: Spawn the set-aside The Inescapable enemy at Central Spire, exhausted and unengaged. Shuffle the rest of The Inescapable encounter set into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Remove R'lyeh Streets from the game, ignoring its text box. Shuffle each open sky and [[Summit]] location in play except for Central Spire into the Summit deck. Each card and token at those locations is discarded. Put 5 of the set-aside open sky cards into play as shown in the Act 2 location placement diagram in the Campaign Guide (page 36). Fill each remaining row and column above, below, and to the right of Central Spire with the bottom card of the Summit deck until there are 3 rows and 5 columns. Shuffle the set-aside Ancient Dome and Aerial Waterfall locations, along with each remaining set-aside open sky card, into the top 5 cards of the Summit deck.
flavor: The alien skyline calls to you, brimming with ancient secrets.
name: Searching the Spires
text: [action] Spend X clues: Reveal X cards from the bottom of the Summit deck. You may put 1 revealed location into play in an adjacent open sky and move to it. (Place that open sky card and each other revealed card on top of the Summit deck in any order.) Objective - If each surviving investigator is at Central Spire, advance.

back_flavor: The otherworldly clouds churn above the ever-shifting skyline, glimmering with alien shapes. Ruby hangs over the edge of a skyscraper, laughing devilishly. "Don't be scared! This is how you know you're alive!" she shouts. Whatever she says next is drowned out by the crack of thunder, and a quickening gale. Ruby throws the end of her line to you and pulls herself to the top.
flavor: The alien skyline calls to you, brimming with ancient secrets.
name: To the Ancient Dome!
text: [action] Spend X clues: Reveal X cards from the bottom of the Summit deck. You may put 1 revealed location into play in an adjacent open sky and move to it. (Place that open sky card and each other revealed card on top of the Summit deck in any order.) Objective - If each surviving investigator has resigned, advance.

back_flavor: At the tower's apex, you see R'lyeh in total. Some ancient calamity leveled the city, sending a shockwave so strong that the twisted spires are bent like blades of grass. What could have caused such great destruction?
back_text: Remove R'lyeh Streets from the game, ignoring its text box. Shuffle each open sky and [[Summit]] location in play except for Central Spire into the Summit deck. Each card and token at those locations is discarded. Put 5 of the set-aside open sky cards into play as shown in the Act 2 location placement diagram in the Campaign Guide (page 36). Fill each remaining row and column above, below, and to the right of Central Spire with the bottom card of the Summit deck until there are 3 rows and 5 columns. Shuffle the set-aside Floating Spire and Aerial Waterfall locations into the top 3 cards of the Summit deck.
flavor: The alien skyline calls to you, brimming with ancient secrets.
name: Scouring the Spires
text: [action] Spend X clues: Reveal X cards from the bottom of the Summit deck. You may put 1 revealed location into play in an adjacent open sky and move to it. (Place that open sky card and each other revealed card on top of the Summit deck in any order.) Objective - If each surviving investigator is at Central Spire, advance.

back_flavor: A shattered frieze depicts a large, clawed implement holding two broken shards of a tower together. A tool like that might be a worthwhile acquisition for Tillinghast.
back_text: Remove Central Spire from the game, ignoring its text box. Shuffle each open sky and [[Summit]] location in play aside from Floating Spire into the Summit deck. Each card and token at those locations is discarded. Put 5 of the set-aside open sky cards into play as shown in the Act 3 location placement diagram in the Campaign Guide (page 36). Fill each remaining row and column below and to the right of Floating Spire with the bottom card of the Summit deck until there are 4 rows and 5 columns. Shuffle the set-aside Western Wall location into the top 3 cards of the Summit deck.
flavor: A distant waterfall and gravity-defying spire beckon you onward.
name: Deadly Skies
text: [action] Spend X clues: Reveal X cards from the bottom of the Summit deck. You may put 1 revealed location into play in an adjacent open sky and move to it. (Place that open sky card and each other revealed card on top of the Summit deck in any order.) Objective - If each surviving investigator is at Floating Spire, advance.

back_flavor:
A tremor nearly knocks you loose as you descend the treacherous spires. After several tense minutes, you finally descend to the streets. Andy sits on a glistening boulder, doing his best not to look shaken. "Well. That's another half a dozen rolls of film gone," he sighs with a melancholy air. "At least we're back in one piece. Well, mostly," he laughs, favoring his bandaged arm.
After the rest of your group are gathered, you make your way back to the beach where you made landfall.
flavor: You can recognize the western wall in the distance where you made landfall.
name: Return to the Shoreline
text: [action] Spend X clues: Reveal X cards from the bottom of the Summit deck. You may put 1 revealed location into play in an adjacent open sky and move to it. (Place that open sky card and each other revealed card on top of the Summit deck in any order.) Objective - If each surviving investigator has resigned, advance.

back_flavor: Fetid seawater pools in the ancient streets, stinking of dead fish and rotten detritus. There is a funereal air in the sleeping city: a feeling of deep loss and dread.

flavor: A brilliant map of distant nebulae fills the room, bursting with color and light. A cerulean glob near the edge draws your attention. Staring at it fills your mind with a sharp, chittering alien language and the crash of waves. As you begin to mouth the strange language, a symbol glimmers in the cerulean sphere. Looking at it fills you with a deep yearning, an instinct to dive into deep underwater nests. Is this a word you learned, or an ancient, primordial memory recalled?
name: Glyph Orrery [tdc_rune_d]
text:

[tdc_rune_d]

flavor: Twisting a hidden knob in the relic's base releases a shower of sparks. You nearly drop the relic from surprise, but the "sparks" are merely random pinpricks of light and thick clouds of fog that shift like oil on water. The more you look at them, the more they resemble constellations, patterns of distant stars. The projection looks nothing like the constellations you've seen before, however.

name: Eroded Frieze [tdc_rune_e]
text: Revelation - Attach Eroded Frieze [tdc_rune_e] to your location. Cannot be canceled. If Eroded Frieze [tdc_rune_e] would leave play, set it aside, out of play. [action]: Test [combat] or [intellect] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage. Otherwise, put 1 resource on this card. If there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on Eroded Frieze [tdc_rune_e], flip it and resolve its text.

flavor: Parts of the frieze are worn smooth by the passage of time, but you eventually identify the shapes of mountains, clouds, mist. Within the mist, nightmarish shapes appear to be locked in some kind of struggle. Frightened creatures look up from below. Underneath it all, a cyclopean eye gazes intensely at an underground city deep below the surface. Heavy accenting depicts a roiling mist that fills the streets of the city. Each of the citizens reclines in a look of terrifying repose.

name: St. Elmo's Fire
text: Revelation - Attach St. Elmo's Fire to the nearest location without St. Elmo's Fire attached. Forced - When the round ends: Each investigator at this location takes 1 damage. Attach St. Elmo's Fire to an adjacent location (with investigators, if able).

flavor: You shouldn't have looked down.
name: Acrophobia
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (1). This test gets +1 difficulty for each open sky adjacent to your location. For each point you fail by, you must either lose 1 action or take 1 horror.

name: Wings of Terror
text: Revelation - Put Wings of Terror into play in your threat area. Forced - After you fail a skill test: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Either draw that enemy, or that enemy attacks you (from the discard pile). Then, discard Wings of Terror.

name: Lost in the Clouds
text: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance. - Each investigator takes 2 direct horror. - Resolve the Forced effect on the Eastern Winds/Western Winds story card as if you had drawn a non-[elder_sign] symbol token.

name: Primeval Terror
text:
Patrol (nearest empty [[Summit]] location).
Cannot make attacks of opportunity.
While engaged with this enemy, you may enter open sky as if it were a location. If you defeat or disengage from this enemy while at open sky, you are defeated and suffer 1 physical trauma.

name: Star Vampire
text: Hunter. Relentless. Prey - Most remaining health. Forced - After this enemy attacks: Heal 1 damage from it.

text: Aloof. Patrol (nearest other enemy with no doom on it ). Forced - When the enemy phase ends: Place 1 doom on another non-[[Elite]] enemy at this location. Then, discard Stowaway Drone.

text: Revelation - Put Infected! into play in your threat area. Limit 1 per investigator. Forced - After you end your turn at a location with another investigator or a [[Stowaway]] enemy: Place 1 doom on Infected! [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage. If you succeed, discard Infected!

flavor: "…the Great Old Ones spoke to the sensitive among them by moulding their dreams." - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"
name: Pilgrim Acolyte
text: Forced - After Pilgrim Acolyte attacks: Place 1 doom on it.

name: Pilgrim Leader
text: Aloof. Spawn - Any location (empty, if able). While Pilgrim Leader is ready, each other [[Cultist]] enemy gets +2 fight and gains hunter and relentless.

name: Monstrous Star Spawn
text: Hunter. Massive. Relentless. Prey - Highest [combat]. Forced - When you reveal an [elder_thing] token while fighting or evading this enemy: Heal 1 damage from it.

name: Infected Star Spawn
text: Hunter. Relentless. Prey - Highest [agility]. Forced - The first time this enemy would be defeated: Heal all damage from it and ready it. Forced - When you reveal an [elder_thing] token while fighting or evading Infected Star Spawn: Take 1 horror.

name: Coral Star Spawn
text: Hunter. Relentless. Prey - Highest [willpower]. While Coral Star Spawn has damage on it, it gains alert and retaliate. Forced - When you reveal an [elder_thing] token while fighting or evading this enemy: Take 1 damage.

name: Star Spawn Observer
text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Highest [intellect]. Forced - When you reveal an [elder_thing] token while investigating Star Spawn Observer's location: It engages you and makes an immediate attack.

name: Eye of the Deep
text: Revelation - Put Eye of the Deep into play in your threat area. Limit 1 per investigator. Treat each [cultist] and [tablet] token you reveal during a skill test as if it were an [elder_thing] token, instead. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Eye of the Deep.

name: Cunning Mimicry
text: Revelation - If there are no [[Monster]] enemies in play, Cunning Mimicry gains surge. Otherwise, test [intellect] (3). If you fail, the nearest [[Monster]] enemy attacks you (regardless of its current location).

name: Elder Mist
text: Revelation - Attach Elder Mist to the nearest location without Elder Mist attached. Each investigator at attached location gets -1 [willpower], -1 [intellect],-1 [combat], and -1 [agility]. Forced - After an investigator at attached location succeeds at a skill test by 2 or more: Discard Elder Mist.

name: Corrosive Fog
text: Revelation - Test [intellect] or [combat] (4). If you fail, take 1 damage. If you fail by 3 or more, instead deal 1 direct damage to your investigator and each [[Ally]] and [[Item]] asset you control with health.

name: Voltaic Eel
text: Hunter. Prey - Most clues. While Voltaic Eel is moving during the enemy phase, each fully flooded location is considered to be connected to one another.

name: Dreaming Migration
text: Revelation - If there are no enemies in play, Dreaming Migration gains surge. Otherwise, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must choose one: - The nearest enemy moves to your location and makes an immediate attack. - Draw the topmost enemy in the encounter discard pile.

name: Undersea Hunt
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). This test gets +2 difficulty if your location is fully flooded. If you fail, take 1 damage and increase the flood level of the nearest eligible location.

name: Deadly Torrent
text: Revelation - If your location is unflooded, Deadly Torrent gains surge. Otherwise, you must choose: - Test [agility] (4) to swim to safety. If you succeed, move to a connecting location. If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror. - Test [combat] (4) to stand your ground. If you fail, take 1 damage and discard 1 asset you control that takes up 1 or more slots.

flavor: "I cannot think of the deep sea without shuddering at the nameless things that may at this very moment be crawling and floundering on its slimy bed..." - H.P. Lovecraft, "Dagon"
name: Something in the Water
text: Surge. Revelation - Increase the flood level of the nearest eligible location.

name: Ominous Silence
text: Revelation - Put Ominous Silence into play in your threat area. As an additional cost to play a card, you must either spend 1 resource or take 1 horror. [action]: Test [agility] (3). If your location is not flooded, this test automatically succeeds. If you succeed, discard Ominous Silence.

flavor: "He had an unprecedented dream of great Cyclopean cities of titan blocks and sky-flung monoliths..." - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"
name: Cyclopean Architecture
text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (X), where X is your location's printed shroud. For each point you fail by, choose and discard 1 card from your hand (to a maximum of 3).

flavor: "He said that the geometry of the dream-place he saw was abnormal, non-Euclidean, and loathsomely redolent of spheres and dimensions apart from ours." - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"
name: Crumbling Masonry
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (X), where X is your location's printed shroud. If you fail, take 2 damage.

text: Revelation - Test [combat] (3). If you fail, you must either take 2 horror or deal 1 direct damage to an investigator at your location.

flavor: "I have looked upon all the universe has to hold of horror, and even the skies of spring and flowers of summer must ever afterward be poison to me." - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"

text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (X), where X is your location's printed shroud. If you fail, take 2 horror.

name: The Inescapable
text: Hunter. Relentless. Spawn - Any connecting location (empty, if able). Forced - The first time each round an [elder_thing] token is revealed from the chaos bag: Ready The Inescapable and resolve its hunter keyword (it does not attack).

name: Still Behind You
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each copy of Still Behind You in the victory display. If you fail and The Inescapable... - ...is in play, it moves, one location at a time, to your location and engages you. - ...is not in play, search all in- and out-of-play areas for The Inescapable and draw it. Add Still Behind You in the victory display.

flavor: A hunter perfectly adapted to the lightless deep.
name: Deep One Thrall
text: Forced - After Deep One Thrall engages you: Discard 1 card at random from your hand.

name: Elder Deep One
text: Hunter. Retaliate. Each other [[Deep One]] enemy gains relentless. Forced - After Elder Deep One engages you: Heal 1 damage from each other [[Deep One]] enemy in play.

flavor: "Be careful out there. We have no idea what's lurking in the shadows."
name: Deep One Ambush
text: Revelation - Put Deep One Ambush into play in your threat area. Limit 1 per investigator. Forced - After a [[Deep One]] enemy engages you: It attacks you. Then, discard Deep One Ambush.

name: Tortured Visions
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). This test gets +2 difficulty if you have 3 or fewer cards in your hand. If you fail, take 1 direct horror and discard 1 card at random from your hand.

name: Drawn to Darkness
text: Revelation - Put Drawn to Darkness into play in your threat area. Limit 1 per investigator. Your maximum hand size is reduced by 3 (to a minimum of 1). Forced - When your turn ends, if you have no cards in hand: Discard Drawn to Darkness.

name: Persistent Construct
text: Hunter. Prey - Nearest investigator with an [[Artifact]] asset. Forced - When you defeat this enemy: Spawn each other Persistent Construct in the victory display, exhausted, at your location.

name: Infernal Machinery
text: Revelation - Put Infernal Machinery into play in your threat area. You cannot trigger abilities on [[Glyph]] or [[Artifact]] cards. [action]: Test [intellect] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, discard Infernal Machinery.

name: No Place Like Home
text: Permanent. Uses (8 discoveries). Forced - When you reveal a location: Remove 1 discovery from No Place Like Home. Forced - When the game ends, if there are 1 [per_investigator] or fewer discoveries on No Place Like Home: In your Campaign Log, mark 1 progress under this Task.

name: No Place Like Home
text:
Permanent. Unless this task has been completed, it enters play with its weakness side faceup.
You may take an additional action during your turn, which may only be used to move.

name: Walk in Faith
text: Permanent. Uses (0 signs). [reaction] After an [elder_sign] token is revealed at any location: Place 1 sign on Walk in Faith. Forced - When the game ends, if there are more than 1 [per_investigator] signs on Walk in Faith: In your Campaign Log, mark 1 progress under this Task.

name: Walk in Faith
text:
Permanent. Unless this task has been completed, it enters play with its weakness side faceup.
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] After an [elder_sign] token is revealed at any location: Heal 1 horror from an investigator at that location.

name: Toe the Line
text: Permanent. Forced - When you take 1 or more damage: Place 1 damage on Toe the Line as well. Forced - When the game ends, if the amount of damage on this card equals or exceeds your maximum health: In your Campaign Log, mark 1 progress under this Task.

name: Toe the Line
text:
Permanent. Unless this task has been completed, it enters play with its weakness side faceup.
You get +1 [combat] and +2 maximum health.

name: Good Money
text: Permanent. [reaction] When you gain 1 or more resources: Place 1 of those resources on Good Money. Forced - When the game ends, if there are 5 or more resources on Good Money: In your Campaign Log, mark 1 progress under this Task.

name: Good Money
text:
Permanent. Unless this task has been completed, it enters play with its weakness side faceup.
You begin the game with 5 additional resources.

name: Prove Your Worth
text: Permanent. Uses (4 chances). Forced - After you fail a skill test by 2 or more: Remove 1 chance from Prove Your Worth. Forced - When the game ends, if there are 1 or more chances on Prove Your Worth: In your Campaign Log, mark 1 progress under this Task.

name: Prove Your Worth
text:
Permanent. Unless this task has been completed, it enters play with its weakness side faceup.
Uses (3 chances).
[reaction] When a non-[auto_fail] token is revealed during a skill test at your location, spend 1 chance: Cancel that token.

name: Do No Harm
text: Permanent. Uses (5 obligations). [reaction] After you heal damage/horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset: Remove 1 obligation from Do No Harm. Forced - When the game ends, if there are no obligations on Do No Harm: In your Campaign Log, mark 1 progress under this Task.

name: Do No Harm
text:
Permanent. Unless this task has been completed, it enters play with its weakness side faceup.
You get +1 [agility].
[reaction] After you heal damage/horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset, exhaust Do No Harm: Gain 1 resource.

name: Dreams of Destruction
text: Permanent. Forced - When you take 1 or more horror: Place 1 horror on Dreams of Destruction as well. Forced - When the game ends, if the amount of horror on this card equals or exceeds your maximum sanity: In your Campaign Log, mark 1 progress under this Task.

name: Dreams of Destruction
text:
Permanent. Unless this task has been completed, it enters play with its weakness side faceup.
You have 1 additional arcane slot and get +2 maximum sanity.

name: Plumb the Depths
text: Permanent. Uses (5 obsessions). Forced - After you discover the last remaining clue at your location: Remove 1 obsession from Plumb the Depths. Forced - When the game ends, if there are no obsessions on Plumb the Depths: In your Campaign Log, mark 1 progress under this Task.

name: Plumb the Depths
text:
Permanent. Unless this task has been completed, it enters play with its weakness side faceup.
You get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] After you discover the last clue at your location, exhaust Plumb the Depths: Draw 1 card.

name: Expedition Gear
text:
Uses (3 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply: Heal 1 damage from an investigator at your location.
[fast] Remove Expedition Gear from the game: Move a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location or a connecting location once in any direction.

name: Laudanum
text:
Uses (3 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply: Heal 1 horror from an investigator at your location.
[reaction] When you draw a non-weakness [[Power]] or [[Terror]] treachery, remove Laudanum from the game: Cancel that treachery's revelation effect and discard it.

name: Alien Tablet
text:
Uses (4 secrets).
[fast] During a skill test on a [[Glyph]] or [[R'lyeh]] card, exhaust Alien Tablet and spend 1 secret: The performing investigator gets +2 skill value for this skill test.

name: Diving Suit
text: If your location is fully flooded, you may treat it as if it were partially flooded for the purposes of card effects. Forced - When any amount of damage would be placed on you: Place 1 of that damage on Diving Suit.

flavor: "Life's just one big score, and I plan to be the winner."
name: Ruby Standish
text:
You get +1 [agility].
[fast] If there are no ready enemies at your location, exhaust Ruby Standish: Move to a connecting location.

flavor: "I thought this story was gonna go in a very different direction."
name: Andy Van Nortwick
text:
